data.title: Lionel Messi
data.meta_description: Lionel Andrés Messi, professionally known as Lionel Messi or simply just Messi is an Argentine professional footballer who previously for and captain La Liga club Barcelona. data.text:
“ Did you say something? I can't hear you behind all of my Ballon D'ors ”

—Season 5 Episode 5

Overview Champions Chat Appearances The Randos

Lionel Andrés Messi, professionally known as Lionel Messi or simply just Messi is an Argentine professional footballer who previously for and captain La Liga club Barcelona. He used to play for Ligue 1 club, Paris Saint-Germain and plays for MLS club, Inter Miami. From seasons 1-6, he, along with Cristiano Ronaldo, had been shown as the protagonist of The Champions.

Club History[]

Lionel Messi started his career playing at FC Barcelona after signing in 2003, making his competitive debut in October 2004 as a 17 year old and scoring his first goal on May 1, 2005 against Albacete from an assist from Ronaldinho. Messi became a legend at Barca, earning 6 Ballon d'Or's at Barca and becoming the top scorer and assister, and getting 4 Champions League and 2 Trebles. Around 2021, Barcelona started to get financial problems to where they couldn't register Messi which caused the Argentine to join Paris Saint-Germain. After two seasons at the French club, Messi left PSG in 2023 possibly due to fan harassment. Messi announced that he was taking a break from European Football and settled on a 2 ½ year contract with MLS club, Inter Miami.

Real-Life References[]

Messi was based off of the actual Argentine football player, Lionel Messi.

Messi and Ronaldo seem to have a rivalry in the series which is referenced to their real life rivalry or goat debate.

He is usually shown with a lot of trophies, his most notable being 7 Ballon d'Ors (as of 2023, 8 Ballon d'Ors), 4 Champion's Leagues, & the World Cup.

Trivia[]
